alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:01AM EDT until March 29 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will be flooded with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 12.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16 feet this evening. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 13.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
